fir_details.police_station: Cyber Crime Police Station, South District, Delhi

modus_operandi: Victim received WhatsApp message about high-return investment opportunity
Caller introduced himself as 'Vikram Singh' from 'Golden Wealth Management'
Initial investment of â‚¹50,000 showed fake 200% returns in 3 days
Victim convinced to invest larger amounts progressively
Multiple calls from different numbers building trust and urgency
When victim requested withdrawal, website showed 'maintenance'
All contact numbers became unreachable after final transfer
complaint_summary.victim_statement: I received a WhatsApp message on 15th December 2025 about a guaranteed investment scheme. The caller, who called himself Vikram Singh, said he was from Golden Wealth Management and promised 15% weekly returns. He sounded very professional and even sent me fake registration documents. I made an initial investment of Rs 50,000 and within 3 days, my online dashboard showed Rs 1,50,000. This convinced me to invest more. Over the next few weeks, I transferred a total of Rs 18,47,500 in multiple transactions. When I tried to withdraw on 8th January, the website showed 'under maintenance'. All WhatsApp numbers were blocked and the website disappeared.

suspects.description: Main contact who initiated fraud, claimed to be investment advisor
Called as 'relationship manager', built confidence before large transfers
Called with urgency tactics during final large transfers
Account holder where funds were transferred
